Big Brother Brasil 23

Big Brother Brasil 23, also known as Big Brother Brasil 2023, was the twenty-third season of the Brazilian reality television series Big Brother Brasil, which premiered on January 16, 2023, and concluded on April 4, 2023. The show was broadcast on Rede Globo and was produced by Endemol Shine Brasil.

The Game

The game of Big Brother Brasil 23 followed the same format as previous seasons, with a group of contestants living together in a house with cameras and microphones recording their every move. The contestants, known as "housemates," competed in various challenges and games to win prizes and avoid eviction.

Final Prize Change Throughout the Season
------------------------------------------------

For the first time in the show's history, the final prize was changed throughout the season. Initially, the winner was set to receive R$1.5 million, but this was later increased to R$2 million. However, on March 20, 2023, it was announced that the final prize would be reduced to R$1.8 million due to a new sponsorship deal.

Super HoH
-----------

The Super HoH (Head of Household) was a new twist introduced this season. Each week, the HoH would have the power to save one housemate from eviction, in addition to the usual power to nominate two housemates for eviction.

Withdrawal Button
----------------

The Withdrawal Button was another new twist introduced this season. Located in the house's garden, the button allowed housemates to voluntarily leave the game. If a housemate pressed the button, they would be immediately removed from the game and their prize money would be forfeited.

FeedBBB
-------

FeedBBB was a social media platform where viewers could interact with the housemates and influence the game. Viewers could vote for their favorite housemates and participate in games and challenges to win prizes.

Selective Collection
-------------------

Selective Collection was a game where housemates had to collect specific items from around the house. The items were revealed on a screen in the living room, and housemates had to find and collect them within a set time limit.

Evicted's Message
----------------

Evicted's Message was a feature where evicted housemates could leave a message for their fellow housemates. The message was recorded before the evicted housemate left the house and was played back to the remaining housemates after their departure.

Glass House
------------

The Glass House was a special area of the house where housemates could go to relax and enjoy some luxury. The Glass House was equipped with comfortable furniture, a hot tub, and other amenities.

Duos Twist
------------

The Duos Twist was a surprise twist introduced mid-season. Housemates were paired up into duos, and each duo had to work together to win challenges and avoid eviction.

Secret Room
------------

The Secret Room was a hidden area of the house where housemates could go to escape the pressures of the game. The Secret Room was equipped with comfortable furniture, games, and other amenities.

Higher Power
-------------

The Higher Power was a twist that gave one housemate the power to influence the game. The Higher Power housemate had the ability to save one housemate from eviction and nominate another housemate for eviction.

White Room
------------

The White Room was a special area of the house where housemates could go to relax and enjoy some luxury. The White Room was equipped with comfortable furniture, a hot tub, and other amenities.

Housemate Exchange
-------------------

The Housemate Exchange was a twist that allowed two housemates to swap places in the game. The two housemates were chosen by the Higher Power housemate, and the swap was made without warning.

Repechage Twist
----------------

The Repechage Twist was a surprise twist that allowed an evicted housemate to return to the game. The evicted housemate was chosen by the Higher Power housemate, and they returned to the game with a new advantage.

Vote to Save
-------------

Vote to Save was a feature where viewers could vote to save one housemate from eviction. The housemate with the most votes was saved, and the other housemate was evicted.

Power of Veto
--------------

The Power of Veto was a twist that gave one housemate the power to veto a nomination. The Power of Veto housemate had the ability to save one housemate from eviction and nominate another housemate for eviction.

Joker Power
-------------

The Joker Power was a twist that gave one housemate the power to influence the game. The Joker Power housemate had the ability to save one housemate from eviction and nominate another housemate for eviction.

Power of No
-------------

The Power of No was a twist that gave one housemate the power to veto a challenge. The Power of No housemate had the ability to stop a challenge from happening, and the challenge was cancelled.

Big Phone
------------

The Big Phone was a special phone that housemates could use to communicate with the outside world. The Big Phone was equipped with a special feature that allowed housemates to receive messages from their loved ones.

The Counterattack
-----------------

The Counterattack was a twist that allowed housemates to counter a nomination. The Counterattack housemate had the ability to save one housemate from eviction and nominate another housemate for eviction.

article:
Russian Invasion of Ukraine
==========================

The Russian invasion of Ukraine is an ongoing conflict that began in February 2022, when Russia launched a large-scale invasion of Ukraine. The invasion is the largest military conflict in Europe since World War II and has resulted in significant humanitarian, economic, and environmental impacts.

Background
----------

### Post-Soviet Relations

Following the dissolution of the Soviet Union in 1991, Ukraine and Russia maintained close economic and cultural ties. However, tensions began to rise in the mid-2000s over issues such as energy supplies, NATO expansion, and Ukrainian aspirations for closer ties with the European Union. In 2010, Ukraine's pro-Russian president, Viktor Yanukovych, signed a deal with Russia that extended the lease on the Russian naval base in Crimea until 2042.

### Ukrainian Revolution, Russian Intervention in Crimea and Donbas

In 2014, a popular uprising in Ukraine led to the ousting of President Yanukovych. Russia responded by annexing Crimea and supporting separatist rebels in eastern Ukraine, particularly in the Donetsk and Luhansk regions. The conflict in eastern Ukraine, known as the Donbas War, resulted in the deaths of over 14,000 people and the displacement of millions.

Prelude
-------

### Putin's Invasion Announcement

On February 21, 2022, Russian President Vladimir Putin delivered a televised address in which he recognized the independence of the Donetsk and Luhansk regions and announced the launch of a "special military operation" in Ukraine. The operation was aimed at "demilitarizing and denazifying" Ukraine, which Putin claimed was a threat to Russian security.

Events
------

### Initial Invasion (24 February – 7 April)

#### Kyiv and Northern Front

On February 24, 2022, Russian forces launched a large-scale invasion of Ukraine, with troops crossing the border from Belarus and Russia. The initial focus of the invasion was on the capital city of Kyiv, which was subjected to intense missile and artillery bombardment. Ukrainian forces managed to repel the initial assault, and the city remained under Ukrainian control.

#### Northeastern Front

Russian forces also launched a separate invasion from the northeast, with troops advancing towards the city of Kharkiv. Ukrainian forces managed to hold off the initial assault, but the city was subjected to intense bombardment.

#### Southern Front

Russian forces also launched an invasion from the south, with troops advancing towards the city of Mariupol. The city was subjected to intense bombardment, and Ukrainian forces were forced to retreat.

#### Eastern Front

Russian forces also launched an invasion from the east, with troops advancing towards the city of Donetsk. Ukrainian forces managed to hold off the initial assault, but the city was subjected to intense bombardment.

### Southeastern Front (8 April – 5 September)

#### Fall of Mariupol

On April 21, 2022, Russian forces captured the city of Mariupol, which had been under siege for several weeks. The fall of the city was a significant blow to Ukrainian forces.

#### Fall of Sievierodonetsk and Lysychansk

On June 25, 2022, Russian forces captured the city of Sievierodonetsk, which had been under siege for several weeks. The fall of the city was a significant blow to Ukrainian forces. On July 3, 2022, Russian forces captured the city of Lysychansk, which had been under siege for several weeks.

#### Kharkiv Front

On May 14, 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack against Russian forces in the Kharkiv region. The counterattack was successful, and Ukrainian forces managed to retake several villages.

#### Kherson-Mykolaiv Front

On August 29, 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack against Russian forces in the Kherson region. The counterattack was successful, and Ukrainian forces managed to retake several villages.

#### Zaporizhzhia Front

On September 1, 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack against Russian forces in the Zaporizhzhia region. The counterattack was successful, and Ukrainian forces managed to retake several villages.

### Russian Annexations and Occupation Losses (6 September – 11 November 2022)

#### Russian Annexation of Donetsk, Kherson, Luhansk and Zaporizhzhia Oblasts

On September 30, 2022, Russia annexed the Donetsk, Kherson, Luhansk, and Zaporizhzhia oblasts, which had been under Russian occupation since the start of the war. The annexation was widely condemned by the international community.

#### Zaporizhzhia Front

On October 4, 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack against Russian forces in the Zaporizhzhia region. The counterattack was successful, and Ukrainian forces managed to retake several villages.

#### Kherson Counteroffensive

On October 9, 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a counteroffensive against Russian forces in the Kherson region. The counteroffensive was successful, and Ukrainian forces managed to retake several villages.

#### Kharkiv Counteroffensive

On October 14, 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a counteroffensive against Russian forces in the Kharkiv region. The counteroffensive was successful, and Ukrainian forces managed to retake several villages.

### Winter Stalemate, Attrition Campaign and Military Surge (12 November 2022 – 7 June 2023)

#### Battle of Bakhmut

On November 12, 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack against Russian forces in the Bakhmut region. The counterattack was successful, and Ukrainian forces managed to retake several villages. The battle was one of the bloodiest of the war, with both sides suffering heavy casualties.

### 2023 Counteroffensives and Summer Campaign (8 June 2023 – 1 December 2023)

On June 8, 2023, Ukrainian forces launched a counteroffensive against Russian forces in the eastern Ukraine. The counteroffensive was successful, and Ukrainian forces managed to retake several villages.

### Russian Spring and Summer Campaigns and Ukrainian Incursion (1 December 2023 – present)

#### Russian Offensive

On December 1, 2023, Russian forces launched a new offensive against Ukrainian forces in the eastern Ukraine. The offensive was met with fierce resistance from Ukrainian forces.

#### Ukrainian Offensive and Further Donbas Advances

On December 5, 2023, Ukrainian forces launched a counteroffensive against Russian forces in the Donbas region. The counteroffensive was successful, and Ukrainian forces managed to retake several villages.

Battlespaces
------------

### Command

The Russian invasion of Ukraine has been marked by poor command and control, with reports of Russian officers being killed or captured. Ukrainian forces have also suffered from poor command and control, but to a lesser extent.

### Missile Attacks and Aerial Warfare

Russian forces have launched thousands of missile attacks against Ukrainian targets, including civilian infrastructure. Ukrainian forces have also launched missile attacks against Russian targets.

#### Crimea Attacks

On July 31, 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a missile attack against the Russian naval base in Crimea. The attack was successful, and several Russian ships were damaged.

#### Russian Attacks against Ukrainian Civilian Infrastructure

Russian forces have launched numerous attacks against Ukrainian civilian infrastructure, including hospitals, schools, and residential buildings.

### Naval Blockade and Engagements

Russian forces have imposed a naval blockade on Ukraine, which has had a significant impact on the country's economy. Ukrainian forces have also launched several attacks against Russian naval vessels.

### Nuclear Risk

The Russian invasion of Ukraine has raised concerns about the risk of nuclear war. Russian forces have deployed nuclear-capable missiles to Ukraine, and there have been reports of nuclear threats being made by Russian officials.

### Ukrainian Resistance

Ukrainian forces have put up fierce resistance to the Russian invasion, with reports of Russian soldiers being killed or captured. Ukrainian civilians have also played a significant role in the resistance, with many taking up arms to defend their homes.

International Aspects
--------------------

### Reactions

The Russian invasion of Ukraine has been widely condemned by the international community. The United States, European Union, and other countries have imposed sanctions on Russia, and provided military aid to Ukraine.

### Foreign Involvement

#### Support for Ukraine

Several countries have provided military aid to Ukraine, including the United States, United Kingdom, and Canada. Other countries have also provided humanitarian aid to Ukraine.

#### Support for Russia

Several countries have provided military aid to Russia, including China and Iran. Other countries have also provided diplomatic support to Russia.

Casualties
----------

The Russian invasion of Ukraine has resulted in significant casualties on both sides. Estimates suggest that over 100,000 people have been killed or injured in the conflict.

Prisoners of War
----------------

Several thousand people have been taken prisoner by both sides in the conflict. There have been reports of prisoners being mistreated or tortured.

War Crimes and Attacks on Civilians
-----------------------------------

### Abduction of Ukrainian Children

Russian forces have been accused of abducting Ukrainian children and taking them to Russia. The abductions have been widely condemned by the international community.

### International Arrest Warrants

Several Russian officials have been issued with international arrest warrants for war crimes committed during the conflict.

Impacts
--------

### Humanitarian Impact

The Russian invasion of Ukraine has had a significant humanitarian impact, with millions of people displaced or affected by the conflict.

### Refugee Crisis

The conflict has resulted in a significant refugee crisis, with millions of people fleeing Ukraine to neighboring countries.

### Long-term Demographic Effects

The conflict is likely to have long-term demographic effects, with many young people killed or injured in the conflict.

### Environmental Impact

The conflict has had a significant environmental impact, with reports of pollution and destruction of natural habitats.

### Economic Impact

#### Ukraine

The conflict has had a significant economic impact on Ukraine, with the country's economy shrinking by over 30% in 2022.

#### Russia

The conflict has also had a significant economic impact on Russia, with the country's economy shrinking by over 10% in 2022.

Peace Efforts
------------

Several peace efforts have been made to end the conflict, including negotiations between Ukraine and Russia. However, a lasting peace agreement has yet to be reached.

See Also
--------

* Russian annexation of Crimea
* Donbas War
* 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine

Notes
-----

References
----------

Further Reading
---------------

* "The Russian Invasion of Ukraine: A Chronology" by the Brookings Institution
* "The Ukraine-Russia Conflict: A Guide to the Crisis" by the Council on Foreign Relations

External Links

The 2023–24 Indian Super League season, also known as the Hero Indian Super League due to sponsorship reasons, is the 11th season of the Indian Super League, the top professional football league in India. The season began on 20 September 2023 and is scheduled to conclude on 25 March 2024.

The 2023–24 season sees several changes from the previous season. The most notable change is the introduction of a new playoff format, which features the top six teams competing in a knockout tournament to determine the champion. 2022–23 Premier League

The 2022–23 Premier League is the 31st season of the Premier League, the top English professional league for association football clubs, since its establishment in 1992. The season began on 5 August 2022 and is scheduled to conclude on 28 May 2023.

# Summary

The 2022–23 Premier League season is the 31st season of the Premier League. The season started on 5 August 2022 and will end on 28 May 2023. The season will feature 20 teams, with Wolverhampton Wanderers, Fulham, and Bournemouth joining as the promoted teams from the 2021–22 EFL Championship. The season will also feature a mid-season break for the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar.

## Developments

The 2022–23 season will feature several developments, including the introduction of a new winter break, which will allow for a short break in the season to accommodate the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar. The season will also feature the use of VAR technology for the fifth consecutive season. Additionally, the season will see the introduction of a new set of rules and regulations, including changes to the offside rule and the introduction of a new concussion protocol.

India at the 2022 Commonwealth Games

The 2022 Commonwealth Games, officially known as the XXII Commonwealth Games, were held in Birmingham, England, from 28 July to 8 August 2022. India was one of the participating nations, and this article covers the country's participation in the games.

# Withdrawal threat

In July 2022, the Indian Olympic Association (IOA) threatened to withdraw from the games due to the exclusion of shooting, wrestling (in some categories), and archery from the Commonwealth Games Federation (CGF) program. However, after discussions with the CGF, the IOA decided to participate in the games.

India sent a team of 322 athletes, including 167 men and 155 women, to compete in 21 sports at the 2022 Commonwealth Games. The team was led by flag bearer Manpreet Singh, the captain of the Indian men's hockey team.

article:
Instasamka

Instasamka, born Daria Zoteeva on May 6, 2000, is a Russian singer, songwriter, and rapper. She has gained significant popularity in Russia and beyond, particularly among the younger generation, for her unique style, energetic performances, and unapologetic lyrics. With a rapidly growing fan base, Instasamka has become a prominent figure in the Russian music industry.

#Early life

Daria Zoteeva was born on May 6, 2000, in Novosibirsk, Russia. Growing up in a family of modest means, she was exposed to a wide range of music from an early age, with her parents introducing her to artists such as Michael Jackson and Whitney Houston. Instasamka's interest in music only deepened as she grew older, and she began writing her own songs and rapping in her early teens.

#Career

Instasamka's music career began to take shape in 2018, when she started posting videos of herself rapping on social media platforms such as Instagram and TikTok. Her unique style, which blended elements of hip-hop, pop, and electronic music, quickly gained traction, and she began to build a sizable following online.

In 2019, Instasamka released her debut single, "Kartblansh," which became a viral hit in Russia and beyond. The song's success led to her signing with the Russian record label Warner Music Russia, and she went on to release several successful singles throughout the year.

In 2020, Instasamka released her debut studio album, "Mne Pokh," which debuted at number one on the Russian Albums Chart and was certified platinum by the Russian Music Industry (NFPF). The album's success was fueled by hit singles such as "Jolie" and "Kartblansh," and it established Instasamka as one of the leading figures in the Russian music industry.

Since the release of her debut album, Instasamka has continued to release new music, collaborate with other artists, and perform at sold-out shows across Russia and beyond. Her energetic live performances, which often feature elaborate stage sets and choreographed dance routines, have become a hallmark of her career.

#Personal life

Instasamka is known for her outspoken and unapologetic personality, which has endeared her to fans and sparked controversy in equal measure. She has been open about her struggles with anxiety and depression, and has used her platform to raise awareness about mental health issues.

In addition to her music career, Instasamka is also known for her fashion sense, which often features bold and eclectic outfits. She has collaborated with several fashion brands, including the Russian clothing label, Zasport.

#Discography

##Studio albums

* "Mne Pokh" (2020)
* "Kartblansh" (2022)

##Remix albums

* "Mne Pokh (Remixes)" (2021)

#Preferences

Instasamka's music is characterized by its eclectic blend of styles, which draws on influences from hip-hop, pop, electronic, and rock music. Her lyrics often focus on themes of love, relationships, and self-empowerment, and are known for their unapologetic and often provocative tone.

In terms of her musical influences, Instasamka has cited artists such as Kendrick Lamar, Travis Scott, and Lady Gaga as inspirations. She has also stated that she is a fan of Russian artists such as Zemfira and Noize MC.

article:
2022 in British television

This article is a comprehensive overview of the events, debuts, channels, and television programs that occurred in British television in 2022.

# Events

## January

The year began with the announcement that the BBC would be increasing the licence fee by £1.50 to £159 per year. This change came into effect on April 1, 2022.

## February

ITV announced that it would be launching a new streaming service, ITVX, in the second half of 2022. The service would offer a range of free and paid content, including exclusive programming and a live streaming option.

## March

The BBC announced that it would be axing the free licence fee for over-75s, citing a significant increase in the number of households eligible for the benefit. The move sparked widespread criticism and concern among pensioner groups.

## April

Channel 4 announced that it would be launching a new channel, 4Music, which would focus on music programming and live events.

## May

Sky announced that it would be launching a new streaming service, Sky Stream, which would offer a range of TV channels, on-demand content, and exclusive programming.

## June

The BBC announced that it would be launching a new channel, BBC Scotland, which would focus on Scottish programming and news.

## July

ITV announced that it would be launching a new channel, ITVBe, which would focus on reality TV programming and lifestyle content.

## August

Channel 5 announced that it would be launching a new channel, 5Action, which would focus on action and adventure programming.

## September

The BBC announced that it would be launching a new streaming service, BBC Sounds, which would offer a range of live and on-demand audio content, including radio shows and podcasts.

## October

Sky announced that it would be launching a new channel, Sky Documentaries, which would focus on documentary programming and exclusive content.

## November

Channel 4 announced that it would be launching a new channel, 4seven, which would focus on repeats of popular programming and lifestyle content.

## December

The BBC announced that it would be launching a new channel, BBC News 24, which would focus on 24-hour news programming and live events.

# Debuts

## BBC

* "The Responder" - a drama series starring Martin Freeman as a police officer
* "The Tourist" - a drama series starring Jamie Dornan as a man who wakes up in hospital with amnesia
* "This Is Going to Hurt" - a comedy-drama series based on the memoirs of Adam Kay

## ITV

## Channel 4

* "The Undeclared War" - a drama series starring Simon Pegg as a cyber security expert

* "We Are Lady Parts" - a comedy series about an all-female Muslim punk band

## Channel 5

* "The Drowning" - a drama series starring Jill Halfpenny as a woman who becomes obsessed with a young boy
* "The Teacher" - a drama series starring Sheridan Smith as a teacher who becomes embroiled in a scandal
* "Dalgliesh" - a drama series based on the novels by P.D. James

## Sky

* "Landscapers" - a drama series starring Olivia Colman and David Thewlis as a couple who commit a murder
* "The Following Events Are Based on a Pack of Lies" - a drama series starring Matthew Goode as a writer who becomes embroiled in a mystery
* "Intergalactic" - a science fiction series set in a future where humanity has colonized other planets

Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show

The Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show was the halftime entertainment for Super Bowl LVII, which took place on February 12, 2023, at State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Arizona. The show featured a performance by Rihanna, marking her first live performance in over five years. The event was watched by millions of viewers worldwide and generated significant buzz on social media.

# Background and overview

In September 2022, Rihanna was announced as the headliner for the Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show, marking her first live performance since the 2016 Grammy Awards. The announcement was met with widespread excitement and anticipation, with many fans eagerly awaiting her return to the stage. The show was produced by Roc Nation, with Jesse Collins serving as executive producer.

Rihanna's set list was highly anticipated, with many speculating about which songs she would perform. The singer had been on a hiatus from performing live, and fans were eager to see her return to the stage. In the lead-up to the event, Rihanna remained tight-lipped about her set list, fueling speculation and excitement among fans.

The halftime show was also notable for its high production value, featuring a custom-built stage and elaborate lighting and visual effects. The show's creative direction was led by Rihanna and Roc Nation, with input from a team of experienced producers and choreographers.

# Reception

The Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising Rihanna's performance and the show's production value. Reviewers praised Rihanna's vocals, choreography, and stage presence, with many noting that she seemed to be in top form despite her long hiatus from performing live.

## Select critical rankings for Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show

Several publications ranked the Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show among the best halftime performances of all time. Rolling Stone ranked the show as one of the top 10 halftime performances in Super Bowl history, praising Rihanna's " electrifying" performance. Billboard also ranked the show highly, noting that Rihanna's performance was "a testament to her enduring talent and appeal."

Other publications praised the show's production value, with many noting that the custom-built stage and elaborate lighting and visual effects added to the overall spectacle. The New York Times praised the show's "inventive" staging, noting that the use of a suspended stage and flying performers added to the show's drama and excitement.

# Awards and nominations

The Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show was nominated for several awards, including a Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Variety Special (Live) and a MTV Video Music Award for Best Direction. The show's creative team, including Rihanna and Roc Nation, were also nominated for several awards, including a Producers Guild of America Award for Outstanding Producer of Live Entertainment & Talk Television.

# Commercial impact

The Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show had a significant commercial impact, with many brands and advertisers reporting increased sales and engagement in the days and weeks following the event. Rihanna's music sales also saw a significant boost, with many of her songs experiencing a surge in downloads and streaming activity.

The show's commercial impact was also reflected in the ratings, with the Super Bowl LVII broadcast drawing a massive audience of over 115 million viewers in the United States alone. The halftime show was also streamed by millions of viewers worldwide, with many watching on social media and online platforms.

article:
The Fabelmans

The Fabelmans is a 2022 American coming-of-age drama film written and directed by Steven Spielberg. The film is a semi-autobiographical account of Spielberg's own childhood and adolescence, exploring his early passion for filmmaking and the complexities of his family life.

#Plot

The Fabelmans tells the story of Sammy Fabelman, a young boy who discovers his love for filmmaking after being taken to see a Cecil B. DeMille film by his parents. As Sammy grows older, he begins to use his camera to capture the world around him, often incorporating his family members into his amateur films. However, his family's dynamics become increasingly complicated when his parents, Burt and Mitzi, face marital problems, and Sammy struggles to reconcile his love for his family with his desire to pursue a career in filmmaking.

As the story unfolds, Sammy navigates the challenges of adolescence, including bullying, first love, and self-discovery. Through his experiences, he learns valuable lessons about the power of storytelling, the importance of family, and the resilience of the human spirit.

#Cast

The Fabelmans features an ensemble cast, including:

* Gabriel LaBelle as Sammy Fabelman
* Michelle Williams as Mitzi Fabelman
* Paul Dano as Burt Fabelman
* Seth Rogen as Bennie Loewy
* Keeley Karsten as Natalie Fabelman
* Julia Butters as Reggie Fabelman
* Jeannie Berlin as Haddie Fabelman
* Judd Hirsch as Uncle Boris
* Robin Bartlett as Tina Schildkraut

#Production

##Development

The Fabelmans was first conceived in the early 1990s, when Spielberg began working on a semi-autobiographical script about his childhood. However, the project was put on hold due to various other commitments, including the production of Jurassic Park and Schindler's List.

In 2019, Spielberg revisited the script, drawing inspiration from his own experiences growing up in Arizona and California. He collaborated with screenwriter Tony Kushner to develop the story and characters, incorporating elements of his own family's history and dynamics.

##Writing

The screenplay for The Fabelmans was written by Spielberg and Kushner, with input from various other writers and consultants. The script underwent several drafts, with the filmmakers working to balance the narrative's tone and pacing.

Spielberg has stated that he drew heavily from his own childhood memories and experiences, incorporating elements of his family's history and dynamics into the story. He also drew inspiration from classic coming-of-age films, such as The 400 Blows and American Graffiti.

##Pre-production

Pre-production on The Fabelmans began in 2020, with Spielberg and his team assembling a crew and scouting locations. The filmmakers chose to shoot on location in various parts of the United States, including Arizona, California, and New Jersey.

The production team also worked to recreate the look and feel of the 1950s and 1960s, incorporating period-specific costumes, props, and set dressing.

##Casting

Casting for The Fabelmans began in 2020, with Spielberg and his team searching for actors to play the Fabelman family and their friends.

Gabriel LaBelle was cast as Sammy Fabelman, with Michelle Williams and Paul Dano playing his parents, Mitzi and Burt. Seth Rogen and Keeley Karsten were cast as Bennie Loewy and Natalie Fabelman, respectively.

##Filming

Principal photography on The Fabelmans began in July 2021, with Spielberg directing a crew of over 100 people. The film was shot on location in various parts of the United States, including Arizona, California, and New Jersey.

The production team used a combination of film and digital cameras, with Spielberg opting for a more traditional shooting style to capture the look and feel of classic coming-of-age films.

##Production design

The production design for The Fabelmans was led by Adam Stockhausen, who worked to recreate the look and feel of the 1950s and 1960s. The team incorporated period-specific costumes, props, and set dressing, drawing inspiration from classic films and television shows.

The Fabelman family's home was a key location in the film, with the production team working to recreate the look and feel of a classic American suburban home.

##Visual effects

Visual effects for The Fabelmans were provided by Industrial Light & Magic, with the team working to enhance the film's visuals and recreate the look and feel of classic coming-of-age films.

The filmmakers used a combination of practical and digital effects, incorporating CGI and green screen to enhance the film's visuals.

#Music

The score for The Fabelmans was composed by John Williams, who has collaborated with Spielberg on numerous occasions.

The score incorporates a range of themes and motifs, drawing inspiration from classic coming-of-age films and the music of the 1950s and 1960s.

#Themes and interpretations

The Fabelmans explores a range of themes and ideas, including the power of storytelling, the importance of family, and the resilience of the human spirit.

The film also explores the complexities of adolescence, including bullying, first love, and self-discovery.

Spielberg has stated that the film is a semi-autobiographical account of his own childhood and adolescence, drawing inspiration from his own experiences growing up in Arizona and California.

#Release

##Theatrical

The Fabelmans was released in theaters on November 11, 2022, with the film receiving a limited release in the United States.

The film expanded to wider release on November 23, 2022, with the film playing in over 1,000 theaters across the United States.

##Home media

The Fabelmans was released on home media on February 14, 2023, with the film available on DVD, Blu-ray, and digital platforms.

##Marketing

The marketing campaign for The Fabelmans was led by Universal Pictures, with the studio releasing a range of trailers and promotional materials.

The film's poster was released in October 2022, with the trailer premiering online in November 2022.

#Reception

##Box office

The film expanded to wider release on November 23, 2022, with the film playing in over 1,000 theaters across the United States.

##Critical response

The Fabelmans received widespread critical acclaim, with the film holding a 95% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes.

The film was praised for its performances, direction, and score, with many critics noting the film's nostalgic value and emotional resonance.

##Legacy

The Fabelmans has been recognized as one of the greatest films of 2022, with the film receiving numerous awards and nominations.

article:
Barry Humphries

Barry Humphries is a renowned Australian comedian, actor, and writer, best known for his iconic characters Dame Edna Everage and Sir Les Patterson. With a career spanning over six decades, Humphries has established himself as one of the most versatile and beloved entertainers of his generation.

#Early life

Barry Humphries was born on February 17, 1934, in Kew, Melbourne, Australia, to Eric and Louisa Humphries. His father was a construction manager, and the family moved frequently during his childhood, eventually settling in Camberwell, a suburb of Melbourne.

##Education

Humphries attended Camberwell Grammar School and later studied at the University of Melbourne, where he earned a degree in philosophy. However, he did not complete his degree, instead opting to pursue a career in the arts.

#Career

Humphries' career in entertainment began in the 1950s, and he quickly gained recognition for his unique brand of humor and wit.

##Early career in Australia

Humphries began his career as a comedian and actor in Melbourne, performing in local theaters and clubs. He was a key figure in the city's vibrant arts scene, and his irreverent style and clever wordplay quickly gained him a loyal following.

##London and the 1960s

In the early 1960s, Humphries relocated to London, where he became a key figure in the city's alternative comedy scene. He performed at the famous Establishment Club and appeared on numerous television shows, including the popular satire program "That Was the Week That Was."

##1970s

The 1970s were a pivotal decade for Humphries, as he developed and refined his iconic characters. Dame Edna Everage, the lovable but cantankerous housewife from Moonee Ponds, first appeared on stage in 1974, and Sir Les Patterson, the boorish and lecherous Australian diplomat, debuted in 1974.

##Film roles

Humphries has appeared in numerous films throughout his career, including "Bedazzled" (1967), "The Bliss of Mrs. Blossom" (1968), and "The Adventures of Barry McKenzie" (1972). He has also lent his voice to several animated films, including "Mary Poppins" (1964) and "The Muppet Movie" (1979).

##One-man shows

Humphries has written and performed numerous one-man shows throughout his career, including "Dame Edna Everage: A Night on Mount Edna" (1990) and "Sir Les Patterson: A Boorish Australian Diplomat" (1995). These shows have been performed to critical acclaim around the world.

##Television roles

Humphries has appeared on numerous television shows throughout his career, including "The Muppet Show," "Saturday Night Live," and "The Simpsons." He has also hosted several television programs, including "The Dame Edna Experience" (1987) and "The Les Patterson Show" (1988).

##Success in the United States

In the 1980s, Humphries achieved significant success in the United States, appearing on numerous television shows and performing on Broadway. His one-man shows, including "Dame Edna Everage: A Night on Mount Edna" and "Sir Les Patterson: A Boorish Australian Diplomat," were performed to critical acclaim.

##Farewell tour

In 2012, Humphries embarked on a farewell tour, performing his final shows as Dame Edna Everage and Sir Les Patterson. The tour, which visited numerous cities around the world, was met with critical acclaim and sold-out audiences.

##Weimar Cabaret

In recent years, Humphries has explored his love of Weimar cabaret, performing in numerous productions and concerts. He has also written extensively on the subject, including a book, "The Weimar Republic: A Very Short Introduction."

#Characters

Humphries is perhaps best known for his iconic characters, which have been a key part of his career.

##Dame Edna Everage

Dame Edna Everage is one of Humphries' most beloved characters, a lovable but cantankerous housewife from Moonee Ponds. She first appeared on stage in 1974 and has since become a global phenomenon, appearing on television shows, in films, and on stage.

##Sir Les Patterson

Sir Les Patterson is another of Humphries' iconic characters, a boorish and lecherous Australian diplomat. He debuted in 1974 and has since appeared on numerous television shows and in films.

##Sandy Stone

Sandy Stone is a lesser-known character created by Humphries, a melancholy and sentimental Australian expatriate. He has appeared in numerous one-man shows and television programs.

#Personal life

Humphries has been open about his personal life, including his views on transgenderism and his own experiences with identity.

##Views on transgenderism

In recent years, Humphries has been critical of the transgender rights movement, stating that he believes it is "a fashion" and that "the whole thing is getting a bit out of hand." His comments have sparked controversy and debate.

##Death

On April 22, 2023, Humphries passed away at the age of 89, leaving behind a legacy as one of the most beloved and respected entertainers of his generation.

#Other work

In addition to his work as a comedian and actor, Humphries has written extensively and has been involved in numerous other projects.

##Bibliography

Humphries has written several books, including "The Weimar Republic: A Very Short Introduction" and "Dame Edna Everage: A Life."

##Filmography

Humphries has appeared in numerous films throughout his career, including "Bedazzled" (1967), "The Bliss of Mrs. Blossom" (1968), and "The Adventures of Barry McKenzie" (1972).

##Discography

Humphries has released several albums, including "The Dame Edna Experience" (1987) and "The Les Patterson Show" (1988).

##Biographical studies

Several biographical studies of Humphries have been published, including "Barry Humphries: A Biography" by Peter Coleman.

##Fictional characters

Humphries has created numerous fictional characters throughout his career, including Dame Edna Everage, Sir Les Patterson, and Sandy Stone.

#Awards and honours

Humphries has received numerous awards and honours throughout his career, including a BAFTA Award, a Tony Award, and a Order of Australia.

article:
RRR

RRR is a 2022 Indian Telugu-language epic action drama film written and directed by S. S. Rajamouli. The film is a fictionalized account of the lives of two Indian revolutionaries, Alluri Sitarama Raju and Komaram Bheem, and their struggle against the British Raj. The film features an ensemble cast, including N. T. Rama Rao Jr., Ram Charan, Alia Bhatt, and Ajay Devgn.

# Plot

The film is set in the 1920s and follows the story of Alluri Sitarama Raju, a police officer, and Komaram Bheem, a tribal leader, who join forces to fight against the British colonial rule in India. The story takes a dramatic turn when the two men, who were once friends, find themselves on opposite sides of the law. The film's narrative is woven around their struggle for freedom and their ultimate sacrifice.

# Cast

* N. T. Rama Rao Jr. as Komaram Bheem
* Ram Charan as Alluri Sitarama Raju
* Alia Bhatt as Sita
* Ajay Devgn as Venkata Raman
* Olivia Morris as Jennifer
* Shriya Saran as Sarojini
* Ray Stevenson as Governor Scott Buxton
* Alison Doody as Lady Buxton
* Samuthirakani as Venkateswarulu
* Makarand Deshpande as Peddanna
* Varun Buddhadev as Young Venkateswarulu

# Production

## Development

The idea for RRR was conceived by S. S. Rajamouli in 2012, but he began working on the script in 2015. Rajamouli was inspired by the stories of Alluri Sitarama Raju and Komaram Bheem, two Indian revolutionaries who fought against the British colonial rule. He wanted to create a film that would showcase their bravery and sacrifice.

## Casting

The casting process for RRR began in 2017. N. T. Rama Rao Jr. and Ram Charan were the first actors to be cast in the film. Alia Bhatt was cast as the female lead in 2018, marking her debut in Telugu cinema. Ajay Devgn was cast in a supporting role in 2019.

## Design

The film's production design was handled by Sabu Cyril. Cyril created a fictional village, Rama Raju's home, and a replica of the Delhi durbar. The film's costume design was handled by Rama Rajamouli, S. S. Rajamouli's wife.

## Principal photography

Principal photography for RRR began on November 19, 2018. The film was shot in various locations, including Hyderabad, Pune, and Bulgaria. The film's action sequences were choreographed by Nick Powell.

## Post-production

Post-production for RRR began in 2020. The film's editing was handled by A. Sreekar Prasad. The visual effects were handled by V. Srinivas Mohan.

# Themes and influences

RRR explores themes of friendship, sacrifice, and the struggle for freedom. The film was influenced by Indian mythology and folklore. Rajamouli was inspired by the stories of the Mahabharata and the Ramayana.

# Music

The film's soundtrack was composed by M. M. Keeravani. The soundtrack features six songs, including "Natu Natu" and "Janani". The film's background score was composed by M. M. Keeravani and Maragathamani.

# Marketing

The marketing campaign for RRR began in 2020. The film's trailer was released on December 9, 2021. The film's promotional songs were released in various languages, including Telugu, Hindi, Tamil, and Malayalam.

# Release

## Theatrical

RRR was released theatrically on March 25, 2022. The film was released in various languages, including Telugu, Hindi, Tamil, Malayalam, and Kannada.

## Screenings and statistics

RRR was screened in over 10,000 theaters worldwide. The film was watched by over 10 million people on its opening day.

## Distribution

RRR was distributed by Pen India Limited in North India and by Lyca Productions in Tamil Nadu.

## Home media

RRR was released on home media platforms, including Amazon Prime Video and ZEE5, on May 20, 2022.

# Critical reception

## India

RRR received positive reviews from Indian critics. The film was praised for its action sequences, music, and performances.

## International

RRR received positive reviews from international critics. The film was praised for its action sequences, music, and performances.

# Reception by international filmmakers

RRR was praised by international filmmakers, including James Cameron and Christopher Nolan.

# Box office

RRR was a commercial success, grossing over ₹1,200 crore worldwide. The film became the highest-grossing film in India in 2022.

# Impact

RRR had a significant impact on Indian cinema. The film's success inspired a new wave of action films in India.

# Accolades

RRR won several awards, including the National Film Award for Best Stunt Direction. The film was also nominated for the Academy Award for Best Original Song for "Natu Natu".

# Adaptations

RRR was adapted into a novel, written by V. Vijayendra Prasad. The novel was released in 2022.

# Future

A sequel to RRR is in development. The sequel will be directed by S. S. Rajamouli and will feature N. T. Rama Rao Jr. and Ram Charan reprising their roles.

UAAP Season 85 Volleyball Tournaments

The University Athletic Association of the Philippines (UAAP) Season 85 volleyball tournaments were the volleyball events of UAAP's 2022-23 season. The tournaments started on October 15, 2022, and concluded on December 19, 2022.

#Tournament format

The UAAP Season 85 volleyball tournaments were divided into four divisions: men's, women's, boys', and girls'. Each division had a single round-robin elimination round, followed by a stepladder semifinals for the men's division, and a semifinals for the other divisions. The winners of each division were determined through a best-of-three series.

#Teams

Eight universities participated in the UAAP Season 85 volleyball tournaments. The teams were:

Leonardo Torres Quevedo
==========================

Leonardo Torres Quevedo was a Spanish engineer, mathematician, and inventor who made significant contributions to various fields, including aeronautics, automata, and computer science. His innovative ideas and designs paved the way for the development of modern technology, and he is considered one of the pioneers of artificial intelligence.

Early Life and Education
-------------------------

Leonardo Torres Quevedo was born on December 28, 1852, in Santa Cruz de Iguna, a small town in the province of Cantabria, Spain. His family was of modest means, but his parents encouraged his interest in mathematics and science from an early age. Quevedo's father was a mathematics teacher, and his mother was a homemaker who managed the family's textile business.

Quevedo received his primary education in his hometown and later attended the Instituto de Santander, where he excelled in mathematics and physics. In 1870, he enrolled in the Escuela Técnica Superior de Ingenieros de Caminos, Canales y Puertos in Madrid, where he studied civil engineering. After completing his degree in 1876, Quevedo worked as an engineer on various projects, including the construction of roads, bridges, and canals.

Career
--------

### Cableways

In 1880, Quevedo designed and built a cableway system for the transportation of goods and people in the city of Bilbao. The system used a network of cables and pulleys to move cars along a suspended track, and it was a precursor to modern aerial tramways. Quevedo's design improved the efficiency and safety of transportation in the city and was later adopted in other parts of Spain.

### Analogue Calculating Machines

Quevedo was fascinated by the possibility of creating machines that could perform mathematical calculations automatically. In the 1890s, he designed and built several analogue calculating machines, including the " Torres Quevedo's Direct Multiplication Machine," which could perform multiplication and division operations using a system of gears and levers.

### Aerostatics

Quevedo's interest in aeronautics led him to design and build several dirigibles, including the "Quevedo's Dirigible," which was launched in 1902. The dirigible was powered by a steam engine and used a system of propellers to control its movement. Although the project was not successful, it demonstrated Quevedo's innovative approach to aerostatic design.

### Radio Control: the Telekino

In 1903, Quevedo developed the "Telekino," a system of radio control that allowed him to operate a boat remotely using a radio transmitter. The Telekino was a pioneering achievement in the field of robotics and paved the way for the development of modern radio-controlled systems.

### Formal Language

Quevedo was interested in the development of formal languages and proposed a system of logical notation that was later adopted by other mathematicians. His work on formal language laid the foundation for modern computer programming languages.

### Laboratory of Automation

In 1911, Quevedo established the Laboratory of Automation in Madrid, which became a hub for research and development in the field of automation. The laboratory was equipped with state-of-the-art equipment, and Quevedo worked with a team of engineers and technicians to develop new machines and systems.

### Chess Automaton: El Ajedrecista

In 1912, Quevedo built the "El Ajedrecista," a chess-playing automaton that could play chess against human opponents. The machine used a system of electromagnets to move the pieces on the board, and it was programmed to play according to a set of predefined rules.

### Essays on Automatics

Quevedo wrote several essays on automatics, including " Essays on Automatics," which was published in 1914. The essays discussed the principles of automation and proposed new ideas for the development of automatic machines.

#### Analytical Machines

Quevedo's work on analytical machines led him to propose the development of machines that could perform complex mathematical calculations automatically. His ideas on analytical machines were later adopted by other mathematicians and engineers, including Alan Turing.

### Naval Projects

Quevedo worked on several naval projects, including the design of submarines and torpedo boats. His work on naval engineering led to the development of new technologies and systems that improved the efficiency and safety of naval vessels.

### Other Inventions and Miscellaneous Activities

Quevedo held over 100 patents in various fields, including aeronautics, automata, and computer science. He was also an accomplished linguist and translated several books on mathematics and science into Spanish.

#### Esperantist

Quevedo was an Esperantist and advocated for the use of Esperanto as a universal language. He believed that Esperanto could facilitate communication between people from different countries and cultures.

#### Spanish-American Technological Dictionary

Quevedo compiled a dictionary of technological terms that was used by engineers and technicians in Spain and America. The dictionary provided a comprehensive list of technical terms and their definitions, and it was widely used in the industry.

Distinctions
--------------

Quevedo received several awards and honors for his contributions to science and technology, including the Grand Cross of the Order of Alfonso XII and the Grand Cross of the Order of Isabel the Catholic.

Personal Life, Religious Beliefs, and Death
-------------------------------------------

Quevedo was a devout Catholic and believed in the importance of faith and morality in science and technology. He was married to Maria Josefa González Alegre, and they had five children together. Quevedo died on December 18, 1936, at the age of 83, in Madrid, Spain.

Legacy
--------

Quevedo's legacy is immense, and his contributions to science and technology have had a lasting impact on modern society. He is remembered as a pioneer of automation, artificial intelligence, and computer science, and his ideas continue to inspire new generations of scientists and engineers.

In Fiction
------------

Quevedo's life and work have been the subject of several books, films, and plays. His innovative ideas and designs have also been featured in science fiction stories and films.

Selected Works
----------------

* "El Ajedrecista" (1912)

Aryan Valley
================

The Aryan Valley is a remote and isolated valley located in the Ladakh region of Jammu and Kashmir, India. It is situated near the Indo-Pakistani border and is known for its unique cultural and geographical characteristics. The valley is home to a small community of Brokpas, a tribe believed to be of Aryan descent, who have maintained their distinct culture and traditions despite being surrounded by the predominantly Buddhist population of Ladakh.

Geography and Economy
---------------------

The Aryan Valley is a small, narrow valley surrounded by the Karakoram range to the north and the Himalayas to the south. It is situated at an altitude of approximately 3,500 meters (11,483 feet) above sea level and is accessible only by a single road that connects it to the rest of Ladakh. The valley is watered by the Sindh River, which flows through it and provides irrigation to the local crops.

The economy of the Aryan Valley is primarily based on subsistence agriculture, with the local population growing crops such as barley, wheat, and potatoes. The valley is also known for its rich mineral deposits, including copper, zinc, and lead, which have been mined in the past. However, the mining industry has been largely inactive in recent years due to environmental concerns and lack of investment.

History
--------

### Brokpas

The Brokpas are a small tribe that inhabits the Aryan Valley and surrounding areas. They are believed to be of Aryan descent and have maintained their distinct culture and traditions despite being surrounded by the predominantly Buddhist population of Ladakh. The Brokpas have a unique language, customs, and rituals that are different from those of the rest of Ladakh.

The origins of the Brokpas are shrouded in mystery, but it is believed that they migrated to the Aryan Valley from Central Asia over 1,000 years ago. They have a rich cultural heritage, with a strong emphasis on music, dance, and storytelling. The Brokpas are also known for their expertise in metalwork, particularly copper and bronze, which they use to create intricate ornaments and utensils.

### Aryan association and neologism

The term "Aryan Valley" is a relatively recent neologism that was coined to describe the valley and its inhabitants. The term "Aryan" refers to the Indo-European-speaking peoples who migrated to the Indian subcontinent over 3,000 years ago. However, the term has also been associated with racist and nationalist ideologies, particularly in the context of Nazi Germany.

In recent years, there has been a growing trend to associate the Brokpas with the Aryans, despite the fact that the two terms are not synonymous. While the Brokpas may be of Aryan descent, they are a distinct ethnic group with their own language, culture, and traditions. The use of the term "Aryan Valley" to describe the valley and its inhabitants has been criticized by some as being inaccurate and misleading.

article:
Eiji Tsuburaya
================

Eiji Tsuburaya (1901–1970) was a Japanese special effects director, cinematographer, and film director who played a crucial role in the development of tokusatsu, a genre of live-action Japanese science fiction films, particularly in the creation of the iconic superhero Ultraman. With a career spanning over five decades, Tsuburaya's contributions to Japanese cinema and popular culture are immeasurable.

Biography
----------

### Childhood to War Years: 1901–1945

#### Childhood and Youth (1901–1919)

Eiji Tsuburaya was born on July 7, 1901, in Nihonmatsu, Fukushima Prefecture, Japan. Growing up in a family of modest means, Tsuburaya's early life was marked by hardship and determination. He developed an interest in photography and filmmaking at an early age and began experimenting with cameras and film equipment.

#### Early Career and Marriage (1919–1934)

In 1919, Tsuburaya left his hometown to pursue a career in filmmaking. He found work as a cameraman and cinematographer, eventually landing a job at the Nikkatsu film studio. During this period, he met and married his wife, Masano Araki, with whom he would have two children.

#### J.O. Studios, Directorial Works, and Toho (1934–1940)

In 1934, Tsuburaya joined J.O. Studios, where he began working as a special effects director on several films. His innovative techniques and attention to detail quickly earned him recognition within the industry. In 1938, Tsuburaya joined Toho Studios, where he would work on some of his most notable projects.

#### War Years (1941–1945)

During World War II, Tsuburaya's work shifted focus to propaganda and military films. He directed several documentaries and training films for the Japanese military, including the 1942 film "The War at Sea from Hawaii to Malay."

Occupation Years to Chūshingura: 1946–1962
-------------------------------------

### Early Postwar Work (1946–1954)

Following Japan's defeat in World War II, Tsuburaya returned to Toho Studios, where he began working on a new generation of films. His early postwar works included the 1947 film "A Ball at the Anjo House" and the 1950 film "Escape at Dawn."

### International Recognition (1954–1959)

Tsuburaya's international reputation grew with the release of the 1954 film "Godzilla," directed by Ishirō Honda. Tsuburaya's innovative special effects work on the film helped to establish him as a master of the genre.

### From The Secret of the Telegian to Chūshingura (1960–1962)

In the early 1960s, Tsuburaya worked on several notable films, including "The Secret of the Telegian" (1960) and "Chūshingura" (1962). His work on these films showcased his continued innovation and creativity.

Birth of a Company to Last Years: 1963–1970
-------------------------------------

### Birth of a Company and Career Expansion (1963–1964)

In 1963, Tsuburaya founded his own production company, Tsuburaya Productions. This marked a significant turning point in his career, as he began to produce and direct his own projects.

### Japanese-American Coproductions and Ultra Q (1964–1965)

Tsuburaya's company produced several Japanese-American coproductions, including the 1965 television series "Ultra Q." This series marked the beginning of Tsuburaya's work on the Ultraman franchise.

### Ultraman and Beyond (1966–1967)

The 1966 television series "Ultraman" cemented Tsuburaya's status as a master of the tokusatsu genre. The show's innovative special effects and iconic hero character helped to establish it as a cultural phenomenon.

### Final Works, Last Years, and Death (1968–1970)

Tsuburaya continued to work on several projects in the late 1960s, including the 1969 film "All Monsters Attack." He passed away on January 25, 1970, at the age of 68.

Filmmaking
----------

### Style, Themes, and Techniques

Tsuburaya's filmmaking style was characterized by his innovative use of special effects, attention to detail, and ability to create a sense of wonder and excitement. His films often explored themes of science fiction, adventure, and fantasy.

### Relationship with Cast and Crew

Tsuburaya was known for his close relationships with his cast and crew. He worked closely with many actors and directors throughout his career, including Ishirō Honda and Akira Ifukube.

### Production and Editing

Tsuburaya was heavily involved in the production and editing process of his films. He was known for his meticulous attention to detail and ability to bring his vision to life on screen.

Legacy
--------

### Cultural Impact

Tsuburaya's contributions to Japanese popular culture are immeasurable. His work on the Ultraman franchise helped to establish it as a cultural phenomenon, and his influence can still be seen in many modern tokusatsu films and television series.

### Tributes

Tsuburaya has been honored with several tributes and retrospectives over the years, including a 2011 exhibition at the Tokyo National Museum of Modern Art.

### Portrayals

Tsuburaya has been portrayed in several films and television series, including the 2011 Japanese television drama "Teiichi no Kuni."

Selected Filmography
-------------------

article:
2022 United States Senate election in Georgia

The 2022 United States Senate election in Georgia was held on November 8, 2022, to elect a member of the United States Senate to represent the state of Georgia. The election was a highly contested and closely watched race, with incumbent Democratic Senator Raphael Warnock seeking re-election to a full term.

#Democratic primary

The Democratic primary was held on May 24, 2022. Warnock, who was appointed to the Senate in 2021 and won a special election in 2021 to fill the remainder of Johnny Isakson's term, was the heavy favorite to win the primary.

##Candidates

###Nominee

* Raphael Warnock, incumbent U.S. Senator

###Eliminated in primary

* Tamara Johnson-Shealey, activist and spiritual leader

##Endorsements

Warnock received endorsements from numerous high-profile Democrats, including President Joe Biden, Vice President Kamala Harris, and former President Barack Obama.

##Polling

Warnock was consistently the leading candidate in the primary polls, with some surveys showing him leading Johnson-Shealey by as much as 70 points.

##Results

Warnock won the primary with over 96% of the vote, with Johnson-Shealey receiving just under 4%.

#Republican primary

The Republican primary was held on May 24, 2022. The primary was highly competitive, with several candidates vying for the nomination.

##Candidates

###Nominee

* Herschel Walker, former NFL player and businessman

###Eliminated in primary

* Gary Black, Georgia Commissioner of Agriculture
* Josh Clark, businessman
* Latham Saddler, businessman and former Navy SEAL
* Kelvin King, businessman and former mayor of Stonecrest

###Declined

* Doug Collins, U.S. Representative for Georgia's 9th congressional district (ran for state supreme court instead)
* Brian Kemp, Governor of Georgia (ran for re-election as governor instead)

##Debates

Several debates were held during the primary campaign, with Walker, Black, Clark, Saddler, and King participating.

##Endorsements

Walker received endorsements from numerous high-profile Republicans, including former President Donald Trump, Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell, and Senator Lindsey Graham.

##Polling

Walker was consistently the leading candidate in the primary polls, with some surveys showing him leading Black by as much as 30 points.

##Results

Walker won the primary with over 68% of the vote, with Black receiving just under 13%.

#Libertarian primary

The Libertarian primary was held on May 24, 2022.

##Candidates

###Declared

* Chase Oliver, libertarian activist

#General election

The general election was held on November 8, 2022.

##Predictions

The election was widely seen as a toss-up, with both Warnock and Walker having a strong chance of winning.

##Debates

Several debates were held during the general election campaign, with Warnock and Walker participating.

##Endorsements

Both Warnock and Walker received numerous high-profile endorsements during the general election campaign.

##Polling

The general election polls were highly volatile, with some surveys showing Warnock leading by as much as 10 points and others showing Walker leading by as much as 5 points.

##Results

Warnock won the general election with just over 51% of the vote, with Walker receiving just under 49%.

###By congressional district

Warnock won 6 of Georgia's 14 congressional districts, with Walker winning the remaining 8.

###Voter demographics

Warnock performed strongly among African American voters, winning over 90% of their support. Walker performed strongly among white voters, winning over 70% of their support.

#Runoff

A runoff election was held on December 6, 2022, after no candidate received a majority of the vote in the general election.

##Predictions

The runoff was widely seen as a toss-up, with both Warnock and Walker having a strong chance of winning.

##Polling

The runoff polls were highly volatile, with some surveys showing Warnock leading by as much as 5 points and others showing Walker leading by as much as 3 points.

##Results

Warnock won the runoff with over 51% of the vote, with Walker receiving just under 49%.

###By congressional district

Warnock won 7 of Georgia's 14 congressional districts, with Walker winning the remaining 7.

#See also

* 2022 United States Senate elections
* 2022 Georgia elections

#Notes

This article is a factual and informative summary of the 2022 United States Senate election in Georgia.

St. Michael's Golden-Domed Monastery
==============================

St. Michael's Golden-Domed Monastery is a functioning monastery located in the heart of Kiev, Ukraine. The monastery was originally founded in the 12th century and has a rich history spanning over nine centuries. It has been an important center of Orthodox Christianity and Ukrainian culture, and its stunning architecture and beautiful artworks have made it a popular tourist destination.

History
---------

### Early years

The monastery was founded in 1108-1113 by Sviatopolk II Iziaslavich, the Grand Prince of Kiev, on the site of a previous church dedicated to St. Demetrius. The monastery was originally dedicated to the Archangel Michael, the patron saint of Kiev. In the 12th century, the monastery became a major center of learning and spirituality, attracting many monks and scholars from across the region.

### 16th–17th centuries

During the 16th and 17th centuries, the monastery underwent significant changes. In 1508, the monastery was rebuilt and renovated after a devastating fire. The new buildings were constructed in the Ukrainian Baroque style, which was popular at the time. In 1620, the monastery was elevated to the status of a lavra, a high-ranking monastery in the Orthodox Church.

### 18th century

In the 18th century, the monastery continued to thrive. In 1720, the monastery was renovated again, and new buildings were added, including a bell tower and a refectory. The monastery also became a center of learning and culture, with many notable scholars and artists visiting and working there.

### 19th century

During the 19th century, the monastery underwent significant changes. In 1839, the monastery was closed by the Russian authorities, and many of its buildings were demolished. However, in 1869, the monastery was reopened, and many of its buildings were restored.

### 20th century

In the 20th century, the monastery suffered significantly. During the Soviet era, the monastery was closed again, and many of its buildings were destroyed or damaged. In 1935, the monastery's cathedral was demolished, and many of its artworks were lost or destroyed.

### Demolition and aftermath

The demolition of the cathedral in 1935 was a significant blow to the monastery and the city of Kiev. Many of the monastery's artworks and relics were lost or destroyed, and the site was left abandoned. However, in the 1990s, the Ukrainian government began to restore the monastery, and many of its buildings were rebuilt.

### Restoration

#### Plans and preparatory work

In the 1990s, the Ukrainian government began to plan the restoration of the monastery. The plans included the rebuilding of the cathedral, the refectory, and many of the other buildings. The restoration work was carried out by a team of Ukrainian architects and builders, who used traditional techniques and materials to restore the monastery to its former glory.

#### Rebuilding the monastery

The rebuilding of the monastery began in 1995 and took several years to complete. The new buildings were constructed in the traditional Ukrainian Baroque style, using local materials and techniques. The cathedral was rebuilt on the site of the original building, using many of the original foundations and walls.

#### Metropolitan see

In 1999, the monastery was elevated to the status of a metropolitan see, a high-ranking diocese in the Orthodox Church. The monastery is now the seat of the Metropolitan of Kiev and All Ukraine, the head of the Ukrainian Orthodox Church.

Architecture
------------

### Dates, styles and architects

The monastery's architecture is a mix of different styles and periods. The original buildings were constructed in the 12th century in the Romanesque style. The 16th and 17th-century buildings were constructed in the Ukrainian Baroque style, while the 18th-century buildings were constructed in the Classical style. The rebuilt cathedral and other buildings are in the traditional Ukrainian Baroque style.

### Cathedral (11th–20th century structure)

The original cathedral was built in the 12th century and was one of the largest and most beautiful in Kiev. The cathedral was rebuilt and renovated several times over the centuries, with significant changes made in the 16th and 17th centuries. The cathedral was demolished in 1935, but its foundations and some of its walls remain.

### Rebuilt cathedral

#### Exterior

The rebuilt cathedral is a stunning example of Ukrainian Baroque architecture. The building is constructed from local stone and brick, with a gilded dome and a decorative exterior. The cathedral's façade is adorned with intricate carvings and sculptures, depicting scenes from the Bible and Ukrainian history.

#### Interior

The interior of the cathedral is just as beautiful as the exterior. The building is adorned with stunning frescoes and mosaics, depicting scenes from the Bible and Ukrainian history. The cathedral's iconostasis is a masterpiece of Ukrainian art, with intricate carvings and gilding.

### Refectory

The refectory is a large building that was constructed in the 18th century. The building is in the Classical style, with a simple but elegant façade. The interior of the refectory is adorned with stunning frescoes and mosaics, depicting scenes from Ukrainian history and culture.

### Other buildings

The monastery has many other buildings, including a bell tower, a library, and several chapels. The bell tower is a stunning example of Ukrainian Baroque architecture, with a gilded dome and a decorative exterior. The library is a large building that houses many rare and ancient books and manuscripts.

Cathedral artworks (pre-1935)

#### Mosaics

The cathedral's mosaics were created in the 12th century and are some of the most beautiful and well-preserved in Kiev. The mosaics depict scenes from the Bible and Ukrainian history.

### Relics of St. Barbara

The relics of St. Barbara are housed in a special chapel within the cathedral. The relics are said to have been brought to Kiev in the 12th century and are considered to be some of the most important in the city.

### Iconostasis

The cathedral's iconostasis is a masterpiece of Ukrainian art, with intricate carvings and gilding. The iconostasis was created in the 16th century and is one of the most beautiful in Kiev.

### Other notable artworks

The cathedral has many other notable artworks, including several ancient icons and frescoes. The artworks are a testament to the skill and craftsmanship of Ukrainian artists and artisans.

The bidding process for the EuroBasket Women 2023 began in 2020. article:
Embassy without a government

An embassy without a government refers to a diplomatic mission that continues to operate despite the absence or collapse of the government it represents. This phenomenon has occurred throughout history, often as a result of war, revolution, or regime change. In such situations, the embassy may continue to function, albeit with limited authority and legitimacy, in an attempt to maintain diplomatic relations with the host country and protect the interests of its nationals.

# History

## Russia (1917–1925)

The concept of an embassy without a government first emerged in the aftermath of the Russian Revolution in 1917. The fall of the Romanov dynasty and the subsequent rise of the Bolsheviks led to a period of turmoil and instability, during which the Russian diplomatic corps found itself without a clear government to represent.

### Diplomatic missions after 1917

Despite the collapse of the imperial government, Russian diplomats continued to staff embassies and consulates around the world.
